meanings.definition: To make a series of high-pitched sounds like a bird
meanings.sent1: The little bird chirruped happily in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The sparrows chirruped in the morning light.
meanings.sent3: The chirruping bird seemed to be singing a joyful tune.
meanings.sent4: The forest was alive with the chirruping of birds, like a natural orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The sound of chirruping birds filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: To utter a series of chirping sounds
meanings.sent1: She chirruped to call her pet parakeet.
meanings.sent2: The crickets chirruped softly in the grass.
meanings.sent3: The chirruping squirrel seemed to be gossiping with its friends.
meanings.sent4: The chirruping of the insects created a soothing background melody.
meanings.sent5: The chirruping of the birds signaled the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To make a cheerful or lively sound
meanings.sent1: The children chirruped with excitement at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The stream chirruped as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The chirruping of the brook sounded like it was laughing at a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chirruped through the room, contagious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The chirruping of the crickets added a cheerful ambiance to the evening.
